content.description:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 column table with 3 rows of data. The heading for column 1 is “x.” The heading for column 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Row 1. x is negative 5. f of x is negative 9. Row 2. x is 0. f of x is 1. Row 3. x is 2. f of x is 5." overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> <mtd> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mtext>  </mtext> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mo>−</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>1</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>2</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The table above gives values of a continuous function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Based on the information in the table, which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has at most one zero.

<math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a relative maximum at <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>.

There exists a value <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 5 is less than c, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>, such that <math alttext="f of c equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>.

There exists a value <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 5 is less than c, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>, such that <math alttext="f prime of c, equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>.

content.answer: There exists a value <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 5 is less than c, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>, such that <math alttext="f of c equals 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math>.

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
